title: .NET 9.0 Breaking Changes
description: Breaking changes introduced in .NET 9.0 across all technology areas

breaks.title: Dev cert export no longer creates folder
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where exporting the development certificate no longer creates the target directory if it doesn't exist.

breaks.title: Forwarded Headers Middleware ignores X-Forwarded-* headers from unknown proxies
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core where Forwarded Headers Middleware now ignores headers from proxies that aren't explicitly configured as trusted.

breaks.title: HostBuilder enables ValidateOnBuild/ValidateScopes in development environment
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where HostBuilder now enables ValidateOnBuild and ValidateScopes in the development environment.

breaks.title: DefaultKeyResolution.ShouldGenerateNewKey has altered meaning
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9.0 where DefaultKeyResolution.ShouldGenerateNewKey has a slightly altered meaning.

breaks.title: Legacy Mono and Emscripten JavaScript APIs not exported to global namespace in Blazor WebAssembly apps
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where legacy Mono and Emscripten APIs are now accessible through the Blazor.runtime object instead of the global namespace.

breaks.title: Middleware types with multiple constructors
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in ASP.NET Core 9 where having multiple constructors in a middleware type can cause an exception at runtime.

breaks.title: .NET Monitor images simplified to version-only tags
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in containers where the .NET Monitor 9 image offering has been simplified to only provide Azure Linux distroless images.

breaks.title: .NET 9 container images no longer install `zlib`
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in containers where .NET 9 container images no longer install the zlib package.

breaks.title: Ambiguous overload resolution affecting StringValues implicit operators
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where ambiguous overload resolution now throws error CS0121.

breaks.title: IncrementingPollingCounter initial callback is asynchronous
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where the IncrementingPollingCounter initial callback is no longer synchronous.

breaks.title: BigInteger maximum length
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where a maximum length for BigInteger is enforced.

breaks.title: BinaryReader.GetString() returns '\uFFFD' on malformed sequences
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where BinaryReader.GetString() returns "\uFFFD" on malformed encoded string sequences.

breaks.title: Adding a ZipArchiveEntry with CompressionLevel sets ZIP central directory header general-purpose bit flags
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where adding a ZipArchiveEntry with a specified CompressionLevel sets the ZIP central directory header general-purpose bit flags.

breaks.title: Support for empty environment variables
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where passing `string.Empty` to `Environment.SetEnvironmentVariable` no longer deletes the environment variable.

breaks.title: EnumConverter validates registered types to be enum
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change where EnumConverter now validates that the type to be registered is an enum type.

breaks.title: RuntimeHelpers.GetSubArray returns different type
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where the type of array instance returned by RuntimeHelpers.GetSubArray matches the source array.

breaks.title: Inline array struct size limit is enforced
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where the size limit for inline arrays is now enforced.

breaks.title: Default `Equals()` and `GetHashCode()` throw for types marked with `InlineArrayAttribute`
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where the default implementations of `Equals()` and `GetHashCode()` throw an exception for types marked with `InlineArrayAttribute`.

breaks.title: InMemoryDirectoryInfo prepends rootDir to files
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where InMemoryDirectoryInfo prepends the root directory to its file paths.

breaks.title: FromKeyedServicesAttribute no longer injects non-keyed parameter
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries (dependency injection) where FromKeyedServicesAttribute no longer injects a non-keyed parameter.

breaks.title: .NET 9 obsoletions with custom IDs
breaks.description: Learn about the APIs that have been marked as obsolete in .NET 9 with a custom diagnostic ID.

breaks.title: New version of some OOB packages
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in core .NET libraries where updates were made to TFMs and package versions for several OOB packages.
affected_apis: All APIs contained in the affected packages.

breaks.title: C# overload resolution prefers `params` span-type overloads
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where C# overload resolution prefers `params` span-type overloads, which can't be used in `Expression` lambdas.

breaks.title: String.Trim*(params ReadOnlySpan<char>) overloads removed
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in core .NET libraries where the String.Trim*(params ReadOnlySpan<char>) methods have been removed due to potential behavioral changes.

breaks.title: New TimeSpan.From*() overloads that take integers
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where new TimeSpan.From*() overloads were introduced that take integer arguments.

breaks.title: Creating type of array of System.Void not allowed
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where it's no longer allowed to create a type of array of System.Void.

breaks.title: Altered UnsafeAccessor support for closed generics
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where support for UnsafeAccessor with closed generics has been altered.

breaks.title: ZipArchiveEntry names and comments respect UTF8 flag
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in core .NET libraries where ZipArchiveEntry names and comments now respect the UTF8 flag when decoding.

breaks.title: APIs Removed from System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs netstandard2.0
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where certain APIs were removed from System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs netstandard2.0.

breaks.title: SafeEvpPKeyHandle.DuplicateHandle up-refs the handle
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in cryptography where SafeEvpPKeyHandle.DuplicateHandle now increments the reference count of the EVP_PKEY handle instead of creating a new instance.

breaks.title: Windows private key lifetime simplified
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in cryptography where the lifetime of a Windows private key has been simplified.

breaks.title: Some X509Certificate2 and X509Certificate constructors are obsolete
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in cryptography where X509Certificate2 and X509Certificate constructors for binary and file content are obsolete.

breaks.title: Deprecated desktop Windows/macOS/Linux MonoVM runtime packages
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where the desktop Windows, macOS, and Linux MonoVM runtime packages are deprecated.

breaks.title: CET supported by default
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in interop in .NET 9 where CET is supported by default.

breaks.title: Floating point-to-integer conversions are saturating
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where floating point-to-integer conversions have saturating behavior.

breaks.title: Some SVE APIs removed
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 where some SVE APIs that take 32-bit address have been removed.

breaks.title: HttpClientFactory uses SocketsHttpHandler as primary handler
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in networking in .NET 9 where HttpClientFactory now uses SocketsHttpHandler as the default primary handler.

breaks.title: URI query redaction in HttpClient EventSource events
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in networking in .NET 9 where HttpClient EventSource events scrub query strings by default to enhance privacy.

breaks.title: URI query redaction in IHttpClientFactory logs
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in networking in .NET 9 where the IHttpClientFactory implementation scrubs query strings in logs to enhance privacy.

breaks.title: HttpClientFactory logging redacts header values by default
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in networking where HttpClientFactory logging redacts all header values by default.

breaks.title: HttpClient metrics report `server.port` unconditionally
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in networking in .NET 9 where HttpClient metrics now report the `server.port` attribute unconditionally to maintain compliance with Open Telemetry standards.

breaks.title: HttpListenerRequest.UserAgent is nullable
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in networking where the HttpListenerRequest.UserAgent property is annotated as being nullable.

breaks.title: Default RID used when targeting .NET Framework
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where a new default RID is used for apps that target .NET Framework.

breaks.title: 'dotnet sln add' no longer allows invalid file names
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in the .NET SDK where the CLI command 'dotnet sln add' adds support for .slnx solution files and no longer allows invalid file names.

breaks.title: 'dotnet watch' incompatible with Hot Reload for old frameworks
breaks.description: Learn about a breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where 'dotnet watch' requires disabling Hot Reload for projects targeting .NET 5 or earlier.

breaks.title: `dotnet workload` commands output change
breaks.description: Learn about a breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where the `dotnet workload` commands output only the JSON body.

breaks.title: Warning emitted when targeting net7.0
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in the .NET SDK where a warning is issued for apps that target net7.0, which is out of support.

breaks.title: Warning emitted for .NET Standard 1.x targets
breaks.description: Learn about a breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where the a build warning is produced if your project targets any .NET Standard version below 2.0.

breaks.title: `installer` repo version no longer included in `productcommits` files
breaks.description: Learn about a breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where the `installer` repo commit and version are no longer included in the `productcommits` files.

breaks.title: Terminal Logger is default
breaks.description: Learn about a breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where Terminal Logger is used by default for interactive MSBuild invocations.

breaks.title: Version requirements for .NET 9 SDK
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in the .NET 9 SDK where specific versions of Visual Studio and MSBuild are required.

breaks.title: In-box BinaryFormatter implementation removed and always throws
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in serialization where the in-box BinaryFormatter implementation was removed and always throws exceptions.

breaks.title: System.Text.Json metadata reader now unescapes metadata property names
breaks.description: System.Text.Json now unescapes metadata property names, affecting reference preservation and metadata property validation.

breaks.title: Nullable JsonDocument properties deserialize to JsonValueKind.Null
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in serialization in .NET 9 where nullable JsonDocument values deserialize to JsonValueKind.Null instead of null.

breaks.title: ComponentDesigner.Initialize throws ArgumentNullException
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where ComponentDesigner.Initialize now throws ArgumentNullException if the component argument is null.

breaks.title: No exception if DataGridView is null
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where DataGridViewHeaderCell methods no longer throw an exception if the DataGridView property is null.

breaks.title: DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Name starting row index
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where the starting index for the DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject.Name property is now 1 instead of 0.

breaks.title: PictureBox raises HttpClient exceptions
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where `PictureBox` raises HttpClient exceptions for network errors when loading an image from a URL.

breaks.title: IMsoComponent support is opt-in
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where IMsoComponent support is now opt-in.

breaks.title: Changes to nullability annotations (Windows Forms)
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in Windows Forms where some nullable reference type annotations have changed.

breaks.title: New security analyzers
breaks.description: Learn about the .NET 9 breaking change in Windows Forms where new security analyzers have been introduced to prevent accidental leaks of sensitive data.

breaks.title: BindingSource.SortDescriptions doesn't return null
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where BindingSource.SortDescriptions no longer returns null if the data source is not an IBindingListView.

breaks.title: System.Windows.Forms.StatusStrip uses a different default renderer
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for Windows Forms where System.Windows.Forms.StatusStrip uses a different default value for the RenderMode property.

breaks.title: 'GetXmlNamespaceMaps' type change
breaks.description: Learn about the breaking change in .NET 9 for WPF where the backing property of 'XmlNamespaceMaps' has been changed from 'String' to 'Hashtable'.
